content.description:
The best 13a in America? The physical crux is right at the 1st (2 bolts). The pump factor continues for (3 more) spaced out bolts to the headwall. Get ready to have your psyche melted on the 11d(ha!) headwall (2 more bolts). The list of radsters that blew the final headwall is staggeringly awesome.  

  Try to imagine, the steepest wall with the most shallow huecos ever, slopetastic! 20'-30' falls are lobbed here regularly, in particular due to the belayer not being able to see or hear the leader for a bit of the last part of the climb.
content.protection: 7 bolts and a 2 bolt anchor. For the last hair raising part of the climb, the belayer connot see the climber. Safe but long fall potential there.
content.location: If you can find the Eagle, Legends is quite obvious. Start behind a large boulder with a bird poop cap on it. Clip 2 bolts, dyno and start pumping up and right. No getting lost here. Wiring the final headwall on TR is easy and so is the descent. Descent, cruise down the rocks to the East.

content.description: The full package. Filled with crimps, slopers, jugs; bicycles, heel/toe hooks, knee bars; small moves, big moves, in-between moves. A must-visit if you can find a guide who knows where it is. Seems to have settled at V8, but it's a fun problem to work even if it's a little above your pay-grade, as it is broken up into sections and you can pull on from various points.
For the hardman/woman, this is the very inviting hunk of rock(on your right) as you drive towards the Hueco Tanks entrance.
